author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Report inlining context for traps in all codegen rjseward Update all previous code which just passed around a BytecodeOffset when identifying a trap to pass around a TrapSiteDesc instead There are a lot of users here but theyre all very mechanical Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Use inlining information for traps in WasmFrameIter rjseward Signal handling looks up a trap and gives that information to the JitActivation using startWasmTrap WasmFrameIter then reads that information We need to plumb the inlining information all the way through that Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Store inlined caller offset information on TrapSite rjseward Add a sparse map of inlineCallerOffsets to TrapSites similar to CallSites This map lives on the inner TrapSitesForKind class as it is indexed by an entry in the vector A later patch will use this information and fill it in Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Refactor trap site storage rjseward Similar to CallSites in the previous patch move to a struct of arrays approach for storing TrapSites This will also make it easier to have a sparse inlineCallerOffsets map in the next patch Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add mode to WasmFrameIter that visits inlined frames rjseward Add a mode to WasmFrameIter that will read the CallSite data prepared by the earlier patch and use it This mode disables access to physical frame data This mode is used only by FrameIter which is used when generating stack traces Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Refactor WasmFrameIter rjseward The state on WasmFrameIter is difficult to reason about Group the state by kind and note when they are safe to access Add more assertions Reset more state to default values in popFrame Switch from Mode to a boolean flag This helps when inlining is added as thats another independent mode Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add test rjseward Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add CallSites class for storing CallSite rjseward CallSite currently is conceptually three fields Kind BytecodeOffset ReturnAddressOffset These are bitpacked into bytes by combining the bytecode offset and kind However this bitpacking is not truly valid and our static assert here is wrong With very large modules which are very difficult to write tests of we could overflow the bytecode offset limit In addition for inlining we will need a CallSite to be able to represent not just a single bytecode offset but a stack of bytecode offsets for all of the inlined callers Call sites are extremely common so minimizing space usage is important This commit reworks the storage to fix both of these issues with several changes Switch from using an array of structs to struct of arrays approach for CallSite storage The new class is called CallSites This allows us to replace the bitpacking with just storing Kind in a separate vector The overhead for each call site goes from bytes to to bytes If we kept the array of structs the overhead would have gone to bytes due to padding Add a reference to a stack of bytecode offsets inlinedCallerOffsets to CallSite This is created by RootCompiler which maintains a stack The stack is shared for every call site within a function Add a sparse hashmap to CallSites that tracks the inlinedCallerOffsets for each call site This reduces storage because many call sites will not be in an inlined function For baseline none of them will be The inlinedCallerOffsets data is not used yet That will require changes to WasmFrameIter Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug mfbt Add HashTableswap rglandium Im replacing a usage of Vector with HashMap and I need the equivalent of Vectorswap for HashMap Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jonathan Kew
message: Bug Correct the direction of progress as handled by Servo InterpolateColor and update the order of parameters passed by Gecko callers to match rgfxreviewerslsalzman The behavior of Servo InterpolateColor was backward as the progress parameter increased from to it would result in an increasing proportion of the left color and a decreasing proportion of the right one which was highly counterintuitive Callers were in effect working around this by passing end start or right left to the left right parameters of Servo InterpolateColor But the mismatch meant that the meaning of increasing vs decreasing interpolation directions ended up inverted as the interpolation was happening backwards from what the colormix code expects To rationalize the usage here this patch renames the leftright parameters of Servo InterpolateColor to start and end for clarity and makes the progress parameter represent progress from the start color to the end which is the natural expectation for the API Then we swap the arguments at the callsites in Gecko so as to pass start end or left right matching the formal parameters of the function instead of reversing them With this change we can also remove the tweak to adjust hue added in bug at httpssearchfoxorgmozillacentralrevdbeabababeeservocomponentsstylecolormixrs and revert to the condition as written in the spec as left and right are no longer swapped in comparision to the spec description A few reftests are added to confirm that hue interpolation directions increasing vs decreasing longer vs shorter now behave consistently Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Daniel Holbert
message: Bug part Implement layout support for stretch as a blockaxis size with webkitfillavailable as an alias rTYLin Note that both keywords are disabled in the CSS parser for now behind these aboutconfig prefs layoutcssstretchsizekeywordenabled layoutcsswebkitfillavailableenabled Prior to this patch we handled both keywords as pure aliases for mozavailable which has the correct stretch behavior in the inline axis but which just behaves like the initial value in the block axis This patch changes that so that stretch and webkitfillavailable will now actually do the right thing in the block axis if theyre enabled at all via their aforementioned aboutconfig prefs The relevant spec text here is httpsdraftscsswgorgcsssizingvaldefwidthstretch httpsdraftscsswgorgcsssizingstretchfitsizing Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug part Add ComputeStretchBSize which can resolve stretch into an nscoord length as either a contentbox or a borderbox size rTYLin This patch doesnt change behavior The new function is a generalization of a contentboxspecific function that I added in a previous commit here httpshgmozillaorgmozillacentralrevabfb As noted in the patch we might also want to add an inlineaxis version of this new function though I dont have a use for that version yet Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Part Cancel the channel rather than disconnecting listeners for nsDocumentOpenInfo failures rsmaug This allows the load to proceed through the regular RedirectToRealChannel path and get a session history entry specified rather than loading an error page without a session history entry which leads to strange session history behaviour This specific case should be OK to do in this way as the checks will also happen incontent meaning that the error should also occur in content after RedirectToRealChannel without any extra work Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Use inlining information for traps in WasmFrameIter rjseward Signal handling looks up a trap and gives that information to the JitActivation using startWasmTrap WasmFrameIter then reads that information We need to plumb the inlining information all the way through that Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Store inlined caller offset information on TrapSite rjseward Add a sparse map of inlineCallerOffsets to TrapSites similar to CallSites This map lives on the inner TrapSitesForKind class as it is indexed by an entry in the vector A later patch will use this information and fill it in Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Refactor trap site storage rjseward Similar to CallSites in the previous patch move to a struct of arrays approach for storing TrapSites This will also make it easier to have a sparse inlineCallerOffsets map in the next patch Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add mode to WasmFrameIter that visits inlined frames rjseward Add a mode to WasmFrameIter that will read the CallSite data prepared by the earlier patch and use it This mode disables access to physical frame data This mode is used only by FrameIter which is used when generating stack traces Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Refactor WasmFrameIter rjseward The state on WasmFrameIter is difficult to reason about Group the state by kind and note when they are safe to access Add more assertions Reset more state to default values in popFrame Switch from Mode to a boolean flag This helps when inlining is added as thats another independent mode Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add test rjseward Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ryan Hunt
message: Bug wasm Add CallSites class for storing CallSite rjseward CallSite currently is conceptually three fields Kind BytecodeOffset ReturnAddressOffset These are bitpacked into bytes by combining the bytecode offset and kind However this bitpacking is not truly valid and our static assert here is wrong With very large modules which are very difficult to write tests of we could overflow the bytecode offset limit In addition for inlining we will need a CallSite to be able to represent not just a single bytecode offset but a stack of bytecode offsets for all of the inlined callers Call sites are extremely common so minimizing space usage is important This commit reworks the storage to fix both of these issues with several changes Switch from using an array of structs to struct of arrays approach for CallSite storage The new class is called CallSites This allows us to replace the bitpacking with just storing Kind in a separate vector The overhead for each call site goes from bytes to to bytes If we kept the array of structs the overhead would have gone to bytes due to padding Add a reference to a stack of bytecode offsets inlinedCallerOffsets to CallSite This is created by RootCompiler which maintains a stack The stack is shared for every call site within a function Add a sparse hashmap to CallSites that tracks the inlinedCallerOffsets for each call site This reduces storage because many call sites will not be in an inlined function For baseline none of them will be The inlinedCallerOffsets data is not used yet That will require changes to WasmFrameIter Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Frédéric Wang
message: Bug Only clip once CSP violation sample for Trusted Types rsmaug Currently ShouldSinkTypeMismatchViolationBeBlockedByCSP Calculate trimmedSample clipping to the first characters Set sample to the concatenation of sink name trimmedSample Pass the sample to CSPViolationDatas constructor which clips again to the number of characters specified by the securitycspreportingscriptsamplemaxlength preference possibly appending an ellipsis and avoiding cut in the middle of a surrogate pair This patch removes the second clipping in CSPViolationDatas constructor as well as the extra ellipsis so that our behavior is aligned with the specifications and new WPT tests for the eval sink pass For the Function sink followup work will be done in bug This patch also makes ShouldSinkTypeMismatchViolationBeBlockedByCSP rely on the same clipping code as CSPViolationData so that the clipping length can be controlled by the corresponding preference and we dont cut at a surrogate pair There are open questions about our mismatch with the CSP specification that are not specific to Trusted Types see bug for that Corresponding TODOs are added in the code Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jeff Muizelaar
message: Bug Rasterize curves directly with trapezoids instead of flattening rlsalzman This fixes drawing half arcs reduces the triangle count when flattening because we dont have joins and thus improves performance Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Robin Steuber
message: Bug Make common test functionality more self contained rnrishelnalexanderapplicationupdatereviewers The test added in this stack doesnt really do anything new but it does do some things repeatedly that had previously only been done once per test This patch is largely aimed at making that functionality more self contained so that it doesnt break or work inconsistently when repeated The biggest of these changes is to the testprocessupdates behavior Previously it would exit the browser after all update processing is complete Now it additionally writes its PID into the update directory upon completion This makes it more reasonable to make runUpdateUsingApp self contained as there were problems where parts of the app were still running after this function exited causing problems Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Robin Steuber
message: Bug Add testing for the multi session install lock feature rnrishelnalexanderapplicationupdatereviewers Additionally disables the multi session install lock feature by default in update tests so that it doesnt interfere with tests not meant to test that behavior This does add telemetry testing but does not do it as part of the main feature test The problem with testing the telemetry in that test is that something has to stick around after startup to observe the telemetry It is possible to have the update applied by a background task rather than a regular instance of the application and then to have that background task observe the telemetry The problem is that applying the updates with a background task screws up the test because we are making sure that in some cases updates are applied at startup even if another instance is running But background tasks are forbidden from doing exactly that So the telemetry testing for this feature instead lives in the shouldprocessupdates background task used by toolkitcomponentsbackgroundtaskstestsxpcshelltest backgroundtask shouldprocessupdatesjs Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Robin Steuber
message: Bug Split testprocessupdates functionality rnrishelnalexander testprocessupdates currently basically does two totally different things It facilitates testing applying updates via the application startup process by preventing the application from actually starting if the update isnt applied or when it is relaunched as the callback application and If ShouldNotProcessUpdates finds a reason not to process updates it does nearly the opposite it sets the env variable to represent the reason we didnt process updates and lets the application continue to launch in order for a background task to consume that value This did not previously cause problems because we never did any testing that resulted in finding a reason not to process updates at startup that didnt involve also involve starting a background task But the test later in this stack needs to do exactly that motivating this change So this patch will split out functionality into testshouldnotprocessupdates so that the testprocessupdates behavior can consistently be only process updates do not launch the browser Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Robin Steuber
message: Bug Refactor out repeated update testing code rnrishelnalexanderapplicationupdatereviewers The code to start an update download seems to repeated multiple times in a bunch of different places This patch is going to consolidate it so that the next patch in the stack can just tweak that function and call into it rather than writing yet another implementation of almost the same thing Additionally the code to start an app updatesjs update server now exists in at least two xpcshell tests This patch consolidates them into a single implementation startSjsServer Hopefully this is sufficiently distinct from start httpserver which starts a different type of server In addition to moving the implementation it has also been changed to use random ports rather than using the same hardcoded port number every time This is important since xpcshell tests can run in parallel Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Add telemetry to monitor reasons why we dont apply updates at startup rnalexanderapplicationupdatereviewerschutten Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Frédéric Wang
message: Bug Only call GetTrustedTypesCompliantString from workers constructor in a WindowWorkerGlobalScope context rsmaug The spec only mentions WindowWorkerGlobalScope contexts but we also call the worker constructor for other nsIGlobalObject such as BackstagePass See for details httpshtmlspecwhatwgorgmultipageworkershtmldedicatedworkersandtheworkerinterface httpsbugzillamozillaorgshow bugcgiidc Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: kpatenio
message: Bug add ability to access shadowDOM for callout selectors romcreviewersaminomancer The intent of this patch is to add support for feature callout anchors situated in the shadowDOM For instance for the Review Checker migration project we want to add callout messages on the features sidebar icon The actual parsing of the selector itself should be credited to aminomancer Im authoring this patch to make sure we can get the change landed and tested I also verified the change with a few selectors via aboutasrouter For instance if you wish to test with the actual Review Checker sidebar icon you should have the prefs sidebarrevamp and browsershoppingexperienceintegratedSidebar set to true After enabling RC in the sidebar settings add the following anchor to any callout sidebarmain sidebarmainshadow toolsandextensionsshadow mozbuttonviewviewReviewCheckerSidebar Lastly I added a test in browsercomponentsasroutertestsbrowserbrowser feature callout paneljs to ensure shadow works as intended Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Hiroyuki Ikezoe
message: Bug Tweak the returned value of GetSnapPointForDestination rdlrobertson Since bug GetSnapPointForDestination had returned an ineligible snap point For exmaple given that theres a scroll container only wants to snap horizontally and there are snap target points and Then if the user tries to scroll vertically to the function returned as a valid snap position for the vertical scroll operation With this change the function now returns so that the user can scroll vertically to the correct position Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Masayuki Nakano
message: Bug part Make delete handlers call DeleteMostAncestorMailCiteElementIfEmpty before calling InsertPaddingBRElementIfNeeded rm kato Currently HTMLEditorDeleteMostAncestorMailCiteElementIfEmpty is called immediately before finishing everything of HTMLEditorHandleDeleteSelection The method deletes most ancestor mailcite element if it becomes completely empty but if it becomes only having a br it replaces the mailcite with with a br So inserting a padding line break is now inserted before its called so that the result has unexpectedly been changed This patch makes each InsertPaddingBRElementIfNeeded caller calls DeleteMostAncestorMailCiteElementIfEmpty to keep current behavior Unfortunately there is no test about this behavior in various cases Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Masayuki Nakano
message: Bug part Make HTMLEditorAutoDeleteRangesHandlerRun and its callees handle some processes directly immediately after deleting content rm kato Currently the postprocessor HTMLEditorOnEndHandlingTopLevelEditSubActionInternal deletes unnecessary new empty inline ancestors and inserts a padding br at caret point The cause of the reported bug br is not inserted properly when deleting the last word of a block with word deletion is hard to understand because the centralizing the postprocesses approach makes its code complicated because it requires to check or guess a lot of situations and the changes of deletion handlers harder Therefore this patch makes each delete handler handles these postprocesses immediately if and only if its preparation of inserting content Especially AutoBlockElementsJoinerHandleDeleteNonCollapsedRange becomes doing them in multiple places However it fixed a lot of existing bugs Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Masayuki Nakano
message: Bug part Make HTMLEditor clean up unnecessary padding line break when inserting something immediately before it rm kato Both Chrome and Safari clean up unnecessary padding line breaks when they become unnecessary Therefore we should follow that Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Emilio Cobos Álvarez
message: Bug Dont set HWND parent of popups rwinreviewersrkraesig As per the docs This parameter is optional for popup windows It looks harmless but when reparenting the widget via swapFrameLoaders or so for DevTools we keep that association because DidChangeParent doesnt fix it up which is what reorders our windows It would seem that the right thing would be to make DidChangeParent also fix the association so remove the mWindowType Popup check but that doesnt work makes the popup not show up so just restore preregression behavior httpslearnmicrosoftcomenuswindowswinapiwinusernfwinusercreatewindowexa Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jan Varga
message: Bug QM Cache thumbnail private identity id rdomstoragereviewersasuth The nsIQuotaUtilsService interface is restricted to the main thread so the thumbnail private identity id is retrieved on the main thread in the handler for the sessionstorewindowsrestored observer topic It is not retrieved in profiledochange or profileafterchange handlers because those notifications occur very early during startup while the ContextualIdentityService can be initialized after user events start being handled this is done for performance reasons and the start of user events handling is signaled by firing the sessionstorewindowsrestored notification Additionally retrieving the id earlier could trigger the initialization of many JS modules in background tasks which we want to avoid Furthermore some Neckorelated tests expect that the cookies service remains uninitialized after calling do get profile If the id were retrieved during profiledochange it would inadvertently initialize the cookies service as the ContextualIdentityService needs to traverse cookies while creating default identities This would conflict with test expectations So for some time after startup the thumbnail private identity id may not be known This is acceptable as we do not expect specific origin operations to be triggered early Even if they are it would only mean that some optimizations like counting thumbnail private identity temporary origins are not utilized Note xpcshell tests currently do not fire sessionstorewindowsrestored during do get profile so the thumbnail private identity id will not be known in those tests However this functionality can be added later if needed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug part Cycle collect SessionStoreChildmManager in the child process rnikafarrecoresessionstorereviewers Since bug an IPDL actor maintains a strong reference to its manager SessionStoreChild is cycle collected In the child process its manager is BrowserChild which is also cycle collected We need to tell the cycle collector about this edge to ensure that the SessionStoreChild and its BrowserChild are collected at the same time This static cast looks questionable given that the manager of PSessionStore can be either PBrowser or PInProcess but based on SessionStoreChildGetOrCreate we can tell the class of our manager by which process were in Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Nicolas Chevobbe
message: Bug devtools Retrieve cookies for a given host from different jars rtimhuangdevtoolsreviewersochameau This patch changes how were retrieving cookies for a given host We used to retrieve the first window we found for the host and get its associated originAttributes to pass them to ServicescookiesgetCookiesFromHost With CHIPS windows with the same host can have different originAttributes more precisely different partitionKey This means that in order to retrieve all the cookies for a given host we need to call ServicescookiesgetCookiesFromHost with all the different originAttributes we can have for the host This also impacts how we handle editing and removing cookies as we also need the specific originAttributes linked to the cookie that is being modifieddeleted note that adding cookies might also be impacted but by default we put them in the top level document which should put them in the unpartitioned jar A test is added to try to cover all this changes Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Nazım Can Altınova
message: Bug Check in case libName could be nullptr before passing it inside the stdstring constructor in LoadedLibraryInfo constructor rprofilerreviewersflorian Before the sharedlibraries code deduplication we were using nsCString for the LoadedLibraryInfomName After the deduplication we started to use stdstring Before it was fine to pass nullptr as a parameter to nsCString as it could easily handle it and act as if its an empty string But its an undefined behavior on stdstring And passing a nullptr actively crashes Firefox when there is a BHR hang detected as it uses the shared libraries code So now instead of directly passing dl infodlpi name inside stdstring Im checking if its a nullptr or not and if so Im passing an empty string so we dont crash there Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Daniel Holbert
message: Bug Make VectorImageGetWidthGetHeight gracefully fail rather than crashing if internal docs root element is nullptr rtnikkel Based on intermittent crashes in automation it seems like during shutdown two things may happen independently A we gather a memory report that asks our SVG images for their widthheight B we tear down the internal SVG document for our SVG images If they happen in that order A before B then everythings fine but if B happens before A then the widthheight queries in A will find an SVG document with a null pointer for the root element So we need to handle that case gracefully Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: serge-sans-paille
message: Bug Fix memcpy usage to meet standard requirements rjgilbertneckoreviewersxpcomreviewersglandiumkarltvalentinnikagsveltopeterv As mentioned in httpsencppreferencecomwcppstringbytememcpy memcpy requires trivially copyable types Same property holds for memset GCC checks this and clang will do in next release In both cases it can be silenced locally by casting the destination parameter to void This patch introduces the following changes AssignRangeAlgorithm was dispatching on the trivially constructable trait not trivially copyable Note that it is basically a reimplementation of stduninitialized copy n but using the later would bypass some specialization of nsTArrayElementTraitsTConstruct ShBuiltInResources default constructor already performs a memset mCachedAnonymousContentStyleIndexes used to contain stdpairuint t uint t which is not trivially copyable at least under older libstdc Use a more explicit POD type instead PodOperationsh was not checking type requirements it now does and issue a compilation error in case of misuse NetAddr copy and default constructors are already defined so use them instead of plain memsetmemcpy NetAddr has a copy constructor from PSNetAddr use it instead of a plain memcpy Do not create a temporary mozillaphcAddrInfo through a memcpy when what we actually want is a reintepret cast Still perform a memcpy on the bytes to enforce alignment Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Part Render Review Checker in the new sidebar rshoppingreviewersfirefoxdesktopcorereviewers sidebarreviewerssclementsmossopkpatenio Adds a remote content browser to contain aboutshoppingsidebar in reviewcheckerxhtml and update the Review Checker sidebar to use that wrapper document Adds ReviewChecker actors for the sidebar Review Checker panel ReviewCheckerParent is a simplified version of the ShoppingSidebarParent as it does not need to handle the state of the sidebar opening or closing ReviewCheckerChild is just extends ShoppingSidebarChild for now though it will need to be separate in the future Adds a browsershoppingexperienceshoppingSidebar boolean pref to disable ShoppingSidebar actors when they are not needed Fixes AbortError error handling when the outer sidebar browser is removed Note that any autoopening or closing behavior will need to be added afterwards as these actors are not around to check product urls when the sidebar is closed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ray Kraesig
message: Bug add AttributeMacros to clangformat rsylvestre C technically allows the construct struct foo bar as an initialization struct foo a Cism is the type name while bar is the variable name and is the braceinitialization This construct should be formatted in a completely different way than the typedeclaration struct FOO bar here FOO is a macro that expands to an attribute definition or a comment bar is the type name and is the class body These constructs are formally ambiguous at the level of a code formatter without access to macroexpansion and the like Unfortunately after years of assuming that the intended construct common in C codebases like say Gecko is the latter clangformat has suddenly decided to assume instead that its the former To preserve the previous formatter behavior add the AttributeMacros option to our clangformat starting it off with a list of all the attributemacro names from mfbtAttributesh which are marked as applying to classes httpsgithubcomllvmllvmprojectissues Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Drew Willcoxon
message: Bug Remove the Suggest JS backend Part Remove the backend rdaisuke This is part of the main part It removes the backend and the code in BaseFeature and feature subclasses that hook into it As a consequence it also makes the other following changes Remove QuickSuggestbackend eventually Id like to add a Merino backend and then add a new QuickSuggestbackends list that has the Rust Merino and ML backends Add QuickSuggestconfig Replace uses of QuickSuggestbackendconfig and QuickSuggestjsBackendconfig with QuickSuggestconfig Remove the quickSuggestRustEnabled Nimbus variable Update most remaining tests so that they do not assume the JS backend exists I left the browserurlbarquicksuggestrustEnabled pref I would like to preserve the ability to toggle off Rust suggestions while keeping other parts of Suggest enabled even if we dont need it now That seems like a wise thing to do and is similar to how both Merino and the ML backends can be toggled separately Depends on D Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jan Varga
message: Bug QM Cache thumbnail private identity id rdomstoragereviewersasuth The nsIQuotaUtilsService interface is restricted to the main thread so the thumbnail private identity id is retrieved on the main thread in the handler for the sessionstorewindowsrestored observer topic It is not retrieved in profiledochange or profileafterchange handlers because those notifications occur very early during startup while the ContextualIdentityService can be initialized after user events start being handled this is done for performance reasons and the start of user events handling is signaled by firing the sessionstorewindowsrestored notification Additionally retrieving the id earlier could trigger the initialization of many JS modules in background tasks which we want to avoid Furthermore some Neckorelated tests expect that the cookies service remains uninitialized after calling do get profile If the id were retrieved during profiledochange it would inadvertently initialize the cookies service as the ContextualIdentityService needs to traverse cookies while creating default identities This would conflict with test expectations So for some time after startup the thumbnail private identity id may not be known This is acceptable as we do not expect specific origin operations to be triggered early Even if they are it would only mean that some optimizations like counting thumbnail private identity temporary origins are not utilized Note xpcshell tests currently do not fire sessionstorewindowsrestored during do get profile so the thumbnail private identity id will not be known in those tests However this functionality can be added later if needed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Julian Seward
message: Bug wasm allow inlining more than one call target with call ref rrhunt This patch builds on our ability to track multiple callref targets in baseline by adding the ability to speculatively inline more than one target Main changes class CallRefHint turn this into an array of up to bit unsigned ints that can be atomically readwritten as a whole The class has no strong connection to our inlining machinery and so all inliningrelated terminology has been removed InstancesubmitCallRefHints rewrite generalizing existing heuristics for choosing one good hot target to cover multiple targets The combined set of targets now needs to constitute at least wasm call ref percent of the total count for this site and individual targets must achieve at least th of wasm call ref percent CallRefMetricstotalCount remove Its stylistically inconsistent for this routine to be a struct member yet InstancesubmitCallRefHints pokes around adhoc to collect other info FunctionCompilershouldInlineCall renamed to auditInlineableCallees and generalised so as to handle a complete CallRefHint which it can modify FunctionCompileremitSpeculativeInlineCallRef generate an ifthenelse chain for all speculated targets Adjustment of two thresholds javascriptoptionswasm call ref inlining percent reduced from to This makes call ref inlining as a whole slightly more aggressive InstancesubmitCallRefHints increase by a factor of the minimum hotness needed for a callsite to be inlined This makes call ref inlining less aggressive for relatively cold call sites Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug QM Use a Registrar class in QuotaManagerObserverInit for safe observer registration rdomstoragereviewersasuth This patch integrates the Registrar class into QuotaManagerObserverInit streamlining the registration of observer topics while ensuring robust error handling The Registrar class automates the unregistration of previously registered topics if any subsequent registration fails reducing the risk of leaks or inconsistent state during observer initialization This change improves code maintainability and reliability particularly in cases where partial registration might lead to unexpected behavior Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Nazım Can Altınova
message: Bug Make sure that the fragment is alive until the profiler is stopped randroidreviewersmleclairtthibaud This code was crashing because after the profiler is started when user pressed the cancel button to stop it and discard the profile it was dismissing the fragment and stopping the profiler Once we stop the profiler we are also updating the internal profiler state that we keep in kotlin This is bad because We dismiss the popup and call the StopProfiler native code at the same time The popup gets destroyed StopProfiler code finishes executing and calls its success or failure callback Inside that callback we update the kotlin internal profiler state by calling setProfilerState setProfilerState calls requireContext but this function throws IllegalStateException because the fragment is destroyed already after dismiss and it fails to find the associated context See httpsdeveloperandroidcomreferenceandroidxfragmentappFragmentrequireContext So overall this happens because we first dismiss and then try to update the state even though its destroyed So this change makes sure that we wait until we stop the profiler and then dismiss the fragment Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug wpt PR Dont transfer indefinite height stretch to inline axis atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Dont transfer indefinite height stretch to inline axis Consider this testcase html canvas styleaspectratio height stretch background cyan width heightcanvas To compute the intrinsic inline sizes we were treating height stretch as the natural height px and then transferring that to the inline axis through the preferred aspect ratio So the element was px wide However an indefinite stretch should be treated as an automatic size which wouldnt be transferred to the inline axis The fix actually makes the code slightly simpler Signedoffby Oriol Brufau obrufauigaliacom wptcommits abbdadfdbebfecdb wptpr

author: David Baron
message: Bug wpt PR Propagate Range exceptions through InputEventCreate atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Propagate Range exceptions through InputEventCreate When InputEvents constructor is given StaticRange objects converting those objects to Range objects might throw an exception Currently in those cases we have a DCHECK failure in DCHECKenabled builds and store a defaultinitialized range pointing to the Document in nonDCHECK builds This instead propagates those exceptions through the InputEvent constructor Its not really clear what the spec requires since the spec isnt clear about the processing model for this InputEvent constructor in particular the fact that we store these ranges as Range rather than StaticRange is unclear in the spec This is a behavior change but only for an obscure corner of the spec manuallyinitialized events that didnt work correctly before The added test fails without the change crashing in DCHECKenabled builds and failing in nonDCHECKenabled builds Fixed ChangeId Iadddafacbbfd Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc Reviewedby Kent Tamura tkentchromiumorg Reviewedby Siye Liu siliumicrosoftcom Reviewedby Di Zhang dizhanggchromiumorg CommitQueue David Baron dbaronchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits dccabbafeb wptpr

author: Andres Ricardo Perez
message: Bug wpt PR Add options to fillTextCluster to override some cluster values atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Add options to fillTextCluster to override some cluster values The current implementation of ctxfillTextCluster always renders the cluster with the align baseline X and Y values stored in the cluster itself This means that once a cluster is generated there is no way to render them with a different align or baseline and that there is no way to override the stored X and Y values This CL adds an options dictionary parameter to ctxfillTextCluster that enables users to override these values For the X and Y values this means that it is possible use the values stored in the cluster for calculations like where on a circle should a cluster go and then render them exactly in a specified position by overriding this values to In practice this means that calling ctxfillTextClustercluster pos x pos y x y renders the cluster and exactly pos x pos y instead of offsetting it by the values stored in the cluster For align and baseline this allows to decouple the setting used for measuring the clusters from the ones used to render if desired Bug ChangeId Ieddccdebaeeeaeadfeca Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc CommitQueue Andres Ricardo Perez andresrperezchromiumorg Reviewedby JeanPhilippe Gravel jpgravelchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits feacadbbbbafce wptpr

author: Mason Freed
message: Bug wpt PR Add a top scroller position for customizableselect atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Add a top scroller position for customizableselect This updates the way we do scrollable fallback positions using the maxblocksize stretch property That eliminates the need for extra fallbacks for scrolling vs nonscrolling and gets the total list of fallbacks down to three With this change the picker will show up in one of four positions abovebelow and rightleft either with or without scrollbars depending on available space The positiontryorder mostblocksize property is also added so that the fallback with the most space for options gets selected Note while working on this I also discovered two tests that had implicit dependencies on the number of supported fallback positions assuming it was exactly I fixed these tests so that they should pass even if more than are supported Bug ChangeId Icadfcbeabdfffdd Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc Reviewedby Ian Kilpatrick ikilpatrickchromiumorg AutoSubmit Mason Freed masonfchromiumorg CommitQueue Mason Freed masonfchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits aaedccbfccdfbfdc wptpr

author: Sam Davis Omekara (from Dev Box)
message: Bug wpt PR Gap Decorations Parse the columnrulestyle property atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Gap Decorations Parse the columnrulestyle property This CL updates the parsing of the columnrulestyle property to support the CSS Gap Decorations syntax To achieve this a new type is added to the CSSGapDecorationPropertyType enum to represent the style property Following this ConsumeIdent is called when handling cases where the columnrulestyle property is consumed in ConsumeGapDecorationPropertyValue Its important to note that the columnrulestyle property was previously parsed exclusively using the fast parse path through CSSParserFastPathshandled by keyword fast paths properties and CSSParserFastPathsIsValidKeywordPropertyAndValue However this approach is no longer sufficient when parsing multiple values as supported by the new grammar To maintain some parts of the fast parse the CSSParserFastPathsMaybeParseValue path is utilized This allows for fast parsing when possible and falls back to the propertys ParseSingleValue path when necessary The code is exercised through gapdecorationsstylevalidhtml and gapdecorationsstyleinvalidhtml Additionally the columnrulestyleinvalidtxt file has been rebaselined to accommodate the new grammar httpskbabbittgithubiocssgapdecorationsoriginalproposalindexhtmlcolumnrowrulestyle Bug ChangeId Ifdcbcbbaecdd Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc Reviewedby Kevin Babbitt kbabbittmicrosoftcom CommitQueue Sam Davis Omekara samomekarajrmicrosoftcom Reviewedby Kurt CattiSchmidt kschmimicrosoftcom Reviewedby Alison Maher almahermicrosoftcom CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits fdbbaaabef wptpr

author: Carlos Alberto Lopez Perez
message: Bug wpt PR wptrunner On WebKitGTKbased browsers do not open the new test window in a tab atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests wptrunner On WebKitGTKbased browsers do not open the new test window in a tab WPT commit befc changed some things on the webdriver executor like Open the new window for the test via webdriver command windownew instead of using injected javascript to open the new window Open the new window as tab by default instead as of a separate window And in the case of WebKitGTKbased browsers there is currently a bug that when the new test window is opened in a tab instead in a standalone window it causes many timeouts and failures on the WPT tests This has been reported to WebKitGTK here httpswebkitorgb So this commits defaults back the new test window to be an standalone window instead of a tab for the WebkitGTKbased browsers meanwhile the issue is not fixed there Related issue wptcommits aebbcfaddcddcadbfe wptpr

author: Tsuyoshi Horo
message: Bug wpt PR Support Translator API on workers atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Support Translator API on workers Previously the mojomTranslationManager interface was only accessible from frames because it was registered with the mojo binder map only within the PopulateChromeFrameBinders method This CL makes the mojomTranslationManager interface available to workers by introducing a new public method in ContentBrowserClient BindTranslationManager This method is called by the following methods PopulateFrameBinders PopulateDedicatedWorkerBinders PopulateSharedWorkerBinders PopulateServiceWorkerBinders Additionally this CL updates the relevant IDL files to expose the Translator API to workers Fixed ChangeId Ibefffacbddaebbfc Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc CommitQueue Tsuyoshi Horo horochromiumorg Reviewedby Rakina Zata Amni rakinachromiumorg Reviewedby Fergal Daly fergalchromiumorg Reviewedby Takashi Toyoshima toyoshimchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits dacbafbdecdafbfcfc wptpr

author: Timothy Nikkel
message: Bug Only do mozsubtreehiddenonlyvisually checks in the parent process rlayoutreviewersemilio This is a chrome only css property so it could still be used in a UA sheet that is applied to a content document that was created solely to tabsxul decks in a fashion that is more like the rest of csshtml And it still only has that single use in our tree A UA sheet applying this property to content it doesnt control doesnt seem like it could be very useful Even those these checks are simple they are relatively costly because we check them on every frame and when we are traversing the frame tree for display list building or setting a displayport we are often memory bound so pulling in another bit of otherwise cold memory for a rare style struct makes us wait for loading more memory and pushes more useful stuff out of caches The parent process check remains very quick as verified by profiling Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Drew Willcoxon
message: Bug Properly set is sponsored on ML Yelp suggestions rdaisuke The problem is that when YelpSuggestionsnormalizeMlSuggestion is called the passedin ML suggestion already has is sponsored set to true It was set at by UrlbarProviderQuickSuggest But normalizeMlSuggestion returns a new suggestion object that does not include is sponsored so the provider thinks the suggestion is nonsponsored which means canAddSuggestion returns false I fixed it by copying all properties from the ML suggestion to the new suggestion object The new object will have some properties that end up not being used but thats fine normalizeRustSuggestion does not have this problem because it returns the passedin suggestion after modifying it httpssearchfoxorgmozillacentralrevdbdfcabeaabfafbrowsercomponentsurlbarUrlbarProviderQuickSuggestsysmjs Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Mike Hommey
message: Bug Avoid trying to install dist toolchains when bootstrapping from a spidermonkey standalone tree rfirefoxbuildsystemreviewerstaskgraphreviewersahochheidenjcristau The autobootstrap code gracefully handles the lack of information as to what toolchains are available in spidermonkey standalone trees but the fallback code path for when toolchains are not to be unpacked doesnt handle the situation By making the toolchains themselves define whether they are to be unpacked we can remove the fallback code path and use autobootstrap in all cases This makes mach artifact toolchain frombuild stop requiring a manual nounpack but fromtask still needs it because it cant infer that information as it doesnt have the task graph Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Masayuki Nakano
message: Bug Make EditorBaseInitializeSelection not try to restore composition in new text node if its not a TextEditor rm kato The path was introduced in bug to keep composition string visible after reframing the focused text control Therefore its limited to run when its a TextEditor However mCompositionOnTextNodeRemoved is called by EditorBaseInitInternal and EditorBaseInsertTextIntoTextNodeWithTransaction even if its an HTMLEditor In the latter case its called only when the composition string becomes empty Then I realized that TextCompositionOnCharacterDataChanged could extend mCompositionLengthInTextNode when the text node is reconnected and updated by the web app Therefore this patch updates the method On the other hand in the former case its called if composition string container is not in the document So perhaps we hit this case due to some mistakes of focus management of editing state change Fortunately if the instance is an HTMLEditor we need to do nothing in InitializeSelection because disappearing composition string with removing the node was intentionally done by the web app and HTMLEditor will create new Text around IME selection which should be collapsed where the disconnected Text was when the composition is updated Therefore this patch makes the path run only if its a TextEditor Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Rob Wu
message: Bug Default to retryFalse when running xpcshell tests locally rjmaher The retry flag of XPCShellTestThread is currently only used to opt out of retry eg when the test is retried or when run with verify All uses of the retry flag assumes that the test will be retried on failure if retryTrue In bug another way to opt out of retry was added when tests are run sequentially the absence of the MOZ AUTOMATION environment variable implies opting out of retry for sequential tests Consequently test results were suppressed by the retryTrue flag without actually retrying due to the MOZ AUTOMATION check This patch fixes the issue by setting the retry flag to False when MOZ AUTOMATION is not set This results in the following changes mach xpcshelltest selftest passes locally instead of failing mach xpcshelltest pathtotests without sequential now report results without retrying first To get the old behavior run tests with MOZ AUTOMATION Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Kurt Catti-Schmidt
message: Bug wpt PR Grid Serialize gridareas for implict tracks in gridtemplate values atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Grid Serialize gridareas for implict tracks in gridtemplate values This CL fixes an issue with serializing the gridtemplate shorthand when it is defined via longhands that create implicit tracks The current behavior iterates over explicit track sizes which leaves out grid areas that cover implicit tracks The fix is to iterate over the remaining rows defined in the gridarea map to ensure all defined gridareas are serialized This will ensure that gridtemplate properly roundtrips without dropping grid area definitions WPT coverage was very light for gridtemplate shorthands with implicit tracks so I augmented a few existing tests to cover these scenarios No additional issues were discovered There werent any tests explicitly testing the gridtemplate serialization via longhands so I added a new test that fails without this fix gridtemplateshorthandcompositionhtml ChangeId Iffbfacffebacbece Bug Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc Reviewedby Alison Maher almahermicrosoftcom Reviewedby Ethan Jimenez ethavarmicrosoftcom CommitQueue Kurt CattiSchmidt kschmimicrosoftcom CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits ffcfefafcadbca wptpr

author: Jonathan Lee
message: Bug wpt PR wptrunner Lazily post testdriver result while polling the next message atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests wptrunner Lazily post testdriver result while polling the next message wptrunner Introduce WebDriverTestDriverProtocolPartget next message for symmetry with send message which the executor uses to settle async testdriver calls browserside This is a noop refactor that gives vendors more flexibility how to exchange messages with the test page wptrunner Lazily post testdriver result while polling the next message Currently a typical testdriver call takes three WebDriver commands Poll the next browser executor message via the resume script Execute the requested testdriver command eg element click for test driverclick Post the result of from executor browser which resolves the calls promise The testharness executor repeats the above steps in an event loop until a message from indicates the test is complete or a helper thread times out the loop This PR optimizes the speed of testdriverheavy tests by combining and for pairs of consecutive calls by running them in the same execute async script invocation a This PR should be entirely transparent to tests because the browser should eventually see all send message calls in the same order with no changes in testdriver semantics When tested downstream no tests regress b and the following local test sees a modest speedup from to min sh run headless shell wpt externalwpteditingotherjoindifferentwhitespacestyleparagraphshtml vv j a httpswcgithubiowebdriverexecuteasyncscript b httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrctabchecks See Also httpscrbugcom wptcommits dfdbcaeaecbebe wptpr

message: Bug wpt PR Take value phase into account for computed inset properties atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Take value phase into account for computed inset properties ValueForPositionOffset incorrectly returned the resolved value for the computed value phase computedStyleMap already worked correctly because we always pass in a null LayoutObject for that API But for computing end points for discrete transitions it was wrong This also fixes a crash when updating inset transitions for fallback style updates during layout for anchor positioning We were trying to resolve an auto value based on the layout result of an abspos while laying out the very same abspos Bug ChangeId Ifcfcafbcafafb Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc CommitQueue Rune Lillesveen futharkchromiumorg Reviewedby Anders Hartvoll Ruud andruudchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits ceccbaeebadeacdd wptpr

author: Sam Davis Omekara (from Dev Box)
message: Bug wpt PR Gap Decorations Introduce ColumnRuleStyle on ComputedStyle atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Gap Decorations Introduce ColumnRuleStyle on ComputedStyle This CL introduces a new data structure to extend the ColumnRuleStyle property for the gap decorations feature Previously the columnrulestyle property could hold only a single style value However with the gap decorations feature this property can now hold multiple values The CL utilizes the GapDataList template data structure to store these values in the computed style object Additionally sites that expect a single style value have been updated to call GetLegacyValue which returns the single style The code is exercised through the gapdecorationsstylecomputedhtml test Bug ChangeId Icdaebadfeeaabb Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc Reviewedby Alison Maher almahermicrosoftcom CommitQueue Sam Davis Omekara samomekarajrmicrosoftcom Reviewedby Kurt CattiSchmidt kschmimicrosoftcom Reviewedby Kevin Babbitt kbabbittmicrosoftcom CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits bfddecfddfec wptpr

message: Bug wpt PR Update dialog closedby behavior to only close one at a time atestonly Automatic update from webplatformtests Update dialog closedby behavior to only close one at a time Per the discussions at httpsgithubcomopenuiopenuiissues httpsgithubcomwhatwghtmlissuesissuecomment both developer and editor feedback is that the prior behavior was a bit odd In the case where there are nested dialogs the desired behavior is for light dismiss clicks to just pop the topmost dialog off the stack rather than trying to close all nonclicked dialogs This CL implements that behavior and updates the test After implementing this behavior and playing with it a bit I agree with the feedback this feels more like what users would expect Once this lands and I get a bit of feedback Ill incorporate this into the spec PR Bug ChangeId Ibcfbddafcedbe Reviewedon httpschromiumreviewgooglesourcecomcchromiumsrc CommitQueue David Baron dbaronchromiumorg AutoSubmit Mason Freed masonfchromiumorg Reviewedby David Baron dbaronchromiumorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain wptcommits eccdcfeabfb wptpr

author: Mike Conley
message: Bug Prevent autoclosing of the AppMenu FxA panels when generically clicking the FxA menu message CTA rpdahiyaomcreviewers The change in CustomizableUI is required because the routine wasnt designed to handle custom elements with shadow roots The routines job is to walk up the ancestry of the click event and determine if any of the parents have certain characteristics that would indicate that the event should not close the panel and without this change it would bail out as soon as it hit the shadow root if the events original target was inside the custom element In this case the element enclosing the fxamenumessage is the appMenufxamenumessage toolbaritem with closemenunone which this modification now lets CustomizableUI detect Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Ray Kraesig
message: Bug Remove custom filepicker from test code rgstoll The existing code for the browser aboutthirdpartyjs test attempts to load a DLL indirectly by means of a Rube Goldberg process involving a directlyinstantiated filepicker This appears to be the source of the severe flakiness of this test This approach was reasonable when the filepicker was the primary source of deleterious thirdparty DLLs but now that we generally open file pickers outofprocess there isnt as much of a reason to test that particular injection mechanism Lets just load the test DLL directly instead This patch has two caveats The test fails consistently rather than flakily on ASAN builds The reason for that remains to be investigated but probably belongs in a separate bug for now we simply leave it disabled The test expects the DLL to be a shell extension and fails with complaints if its not Theres no other reason to have any of the shellextensionregistration machinery in there though so it can and probably should be removed and the test rewritten accordingly In the interests of swiftly deflaking it though this is also being left for a separate bug Outside of testonly code no functional changes Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Manuel Bucher
message: Bug Copy Clean Link Change keyboard shortcut from u to C when right clicking on a link rantitrackingreviewersfluentreviewerspbzflod u isnt part of the string in the context menu anymore after the rename from Copy Link Without Site Tracking to Copy Clean Link The keyboard shortcut for the address bar for Copy Clean Link is n Unfortunatly n isnt free in the context menu when right clicking the link Therefore we cant make the keyboard shortcut consistent Copy Link Without Site Tracking has been around since Fx released on November So hasnt been that long in the grand scheme of things On one hand we like to avoid breaking muscle memory On the other hand having access keys that arent part of the item name makes them difficult to learndiscover The first consensus was to make the keys consistent by switching to n However that turned out to not work due to conflict with another menu item The new consesus after discovering making both cosistent not working was to still change the keyboard shortcut in the context menu right clicking on links to C Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Ship dxcompilerdll and dxildll rsylvestreglandiumfirefoxbuildsystemreviewers This patch is the first step towards shipping dxcompilerdll and dxildll also referred to as DXC on Windows for WebGPU With this patch DXC is disabled by default at build time and can be enabled on x by adding ac add options enabledxcompiler in the mozconfig file Followup work will include in no particular order Enabling DXC by default Enabling DXC for Windows on x and arm architectures Using our own DXC builds instead of pulling the dlls from the Windows SDK Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Masayuki Nakano
message: Bug part Make HTMLEditorAutoDeleteRangesHandlerRun and its callees handle some processes directly immediately after deleting content rm kato Currently the postprocessor HTMLEditorOnEndHandlingTopLevelEditSubActionInternal deletes unnecessary new empty inline ancestors and inserts a padding br at caret point The cause of the reported bug br is not inserted properly when deleting the last word of a block with word deletion is hard to understand because the centralizing the postprocesses approach makes its code complicated because it requires to check or guess a lot of situations and the changes of deletion handlers harder Therefore this patch makes each delete handler handles these postprocesses immediately if and only if its preparation of inserting content Especially AutoBlockElementsJoinerHandleDeleteNonCollapsedRange becomes doing them in multiple places However it fixed a lot of existing bugs Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: alwu
message: Bug part make it possible to fallback to WMF HW decoder in GPU process if ffmpeg fails to init a HW decoder rstranskychunmin Currently in the GPU process we attempt to create an FFmpeg decoder prior to a WMF decoder If the FFmpeg decoder fails to initialize its HW decoder we should fall back to the WMF decoder for HW decoding instead We aim to avoid silently defaulting to the SW FFmpeg decoder in the GPU process To address this this patch modifies the initialization process ensuring the HW decoder is initialized earlier when creating an FFmpeg video decoder This allows us to determine upfront whether HW decoding via the FFmpeg decoder will succeed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: alwu
message: Bug part make it possible to fallback to WMF HW decoder in GPU process if ffmpeg fails to init a HW decoder rstranskychunmin Currently in the GPU process we attempt to create an FFmpeg decoder prior to a WMF decoder If the FFmpeg decoder fails to initialize its HW decoder we should fall back to the WMF decoder for HW decoding instead We aim to avoid silently defaulting to the SW FFmpeg decoder in the GPU process To address this this patch modifies the initialization process ensuring the HW decoder is initialized earlier when creating an FFmpeg video decoder This allows us to determine upfront whether HW decoding via the FFmpeg decoder will succeed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Andreas Pehrson
message: Bug Cherrypick upstream libwebrtc commit ccb rwebrtcreviewersmjf Upstream commit httpswebrtcgooglesourcecomsrcccbdfaabcaeefa Reset encoder on simulcast layer maxFramerate changes Without this Firefox wasnt passing WPT webrtcsimulcastsetParametersmaxFrameratehttpshtml The main issue is the SetRates APIs RateControlParameters doesnt have a way to model maxFramerate for simulcast layers A long term fix would probably be to represent maxFramerate for all simulcast layers in RateControlParameters This change is a short term fix and resets the encoder iff a simulcast layers maxFramerate has changed and also differs from the maxFramerate of the codec passed to SetRates which matches the layer with the highest maxFramerate Bug None ChangeId Iddafefeaccefab Reviewedon httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc CommitQueue Sergey Silkin ssilkinwebrtcorg Reviewedby Sergey Silkin ssilkinwebrtcorg Reviewedby Ilya Nikolaevskiy ilnikwebrtcorg CrCommitPosition refsheadsmain Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Andreas Pehrson
message: Bug Increase MediaEngineFakeVideoSources framerate on Android rwebrtcreviewersbwc This limitation of th framerate on Android was needed in the past because the Android emulators were terribly slow and we were doing lots of webrtc related work on main thread To be able to pass the webrtcsimulcastsetParametersmaxFramerate WPT the framerate needs to be higher There appears to be no performance problem causing fallout in CI from bringing the framerate on Android to be on par with other platforms Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Andreas Pehrson
message: Bug Use TYPE REPEATING PRECISE CAN SKIP in MediaEngineFakeVideoSource rwebrtcreviewersbwc Some tests are framerate sensitive like WPT webrtcsimulcastsetParametersmaxFrameratehttpshtml Consider a case of a requested fps of ms period and being on a machine where generating a frame in MediaEngineFakeVideoSource takes fps With TYPE REPEATING SLACK the total frame period becomes ms ms ms The effective framerate is then fps which is not enough to pass some tests With TYPE REPEATING PRECIS CAN SKIP the total frame period becomes ms for the case above which is a consistent fps The downside is that CPU usage may go up which could affect overall performance of a CI machine that is struggling to keep up Currently things look good on try Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Benjamin Beurdouche
message: Bug Part Web API for MLS rwebidlipcreviewerssmaugnika This patch contains an experimental Web API for the Messaging Layer Security RFC protocol The API allows to securely generate cryptographic material and build large dynamic groups with stateoftheart security The state both public and secret is stored in the profile and isolated by origin within dedicated databases No secret can be exfiltrated through the API and privacy risks are minimized due to the selected isolation Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Keep track of argument indices with variables rnalexandernrishel We need to add an argument to this executable but it is made more difficult than it needs to be by the fact that we refer to arguments by number all over this code Which to be honest also just makes the code harder to understand than necessary This patch simply swaps out raw index values for variables in order to make this easier to understand There should only be one actual functionality change in this patch Thishttpssearchfoxorgmozillacentralrevdfffdcdbadeaeftoolkitmozappsupdateupdaterupdatercpp particular invocation of LaunchCallbackApp inexplicably passes the path to the callback binary as the first argument instead of the path to the callbacks working directory Presumably this is a bug Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Andrew Sutherland
message: Bug Defend against sync callbacks in Show call redenchuang The crash in this bug seems to indicate that we are receiving a sync observer notification callback during our call to Show and this is resulting in Show returning an error code Because the callbacks will already take mResolver mResolver will be Nothing on return As analyzed in the bug the windows toast notifier seems capable of generating this series of events but this is somewhat speculative and the patch here is defensive in nature Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jon Coppeard
message: Bug Cancel existing GC zeal before calling startgc in test rjandem This is failing because when this test is run with GC zeal enabled we may have started a GC already and so startgc complains Initially when I looked at the test I thought that the call to gczeal would have cancelled any ongoing GC but that is not the case and this needs to happen separately Whether or not this fails depends on whether we are in a GC when the test script runs which depends on the number of GC things allocated by the shell before running the testcase Presumably there is some difference that accounts for why this fails locally and not in CI Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Daniel Holbert
message: Bug part Add stretch to our mochitest invalid values lists for various lengthvalued properties that dont accept csssizing keywords rlayoutreviewersemilio This is essentially a latebreaking followup for earlier changeset httpshgmozillaorgmozillacentralrevfff which added this keyword as an allowed value in some properties but neglected to add it as a disallowed value Per httpsdraftscsswgorgcsssizingsizingvalues the stretch keyword is only valid for width height and their minmax properties Its also valid for properties that are defined to take the same values as those properties eg these properties logical aliases and flexbasis and flex which accept width as part of their syntax The stretch keyword is not valid for other lengthvalued properties in general so its worth asserting that we dont accept it there hence this patch which adds it to a smattering of properties Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug wasm Make LTSII inlining less aggressive rrhunt Numbers collected during experimentation for bug suggest that we could modestly reduce the aggressiveness of inlining without impacting performance and save some code space and Ion compilation time as a result This patch accordingly reduces the basic inlining thresholds by increases the individual perfunction limit by a factor of it was set far too low before and quite frequently cut off inlining of normal functions prematurely The permodule limit remains unchanged as a ridealong in ModuleGeneratorfinishModule fixes somewhat nonsensical logic in the setting of the permodule limit Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Vendor libwebrtc from dbcacf Upstream commit httpswebrtcgooglesourcecomsrcdbcacfeefcfccccb M merge Avoid potential deadlock due to queue in corruption detection In particular some platforms have a limited pool of frames in the capturer stack so we need to avoid stashing raw frames in the frame instrumentation generator that may be dropped by limiting the size of the queue and avoid putting anything in there until we know we will send it to the encoder cherry picked from commit aeedcfadeaab Bug webrtc chromium ChangeId Iaeddeacadacfea Reviewedon httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc Reviewedby Åsa Persson asaperssonwebrtcorg CommitQueue Erik Språng sprangwebrtcorg CrOriginalCommitPosition refsheadsmain Reviewedon httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc CrCommitPosition refsbranchheads CrBranchedFrom adacdcedadcccfacarefsheadsmain

message: Bug Vendor libwebrtc from cea Upstream commit httpswebrtcgooglesourcecomsrcceaabbdffecfded With stereo decoding and mono packets produce mono after CNPLC The workaround in httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc is incomplete because it does not fix the issue for the first decoded mono packet after CNPLC This CL extends the workaround to such a case and adds a unit test for it Note it was verified that the nd packet after CNPLC is trivial stereo Credits jakobiwebrtcorg for raising the concern cherry picked from commit ebbccecdacfbefabca Bug chromium ChangeId Ideefcfdbbccfca Reviewedon httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc Reviewedby Jakob Ivarsson jakobiwebrtcorg CommitQueue Alessio Bazzica alessiobwebrtcorg CrOriginalCommitPosition refsheadsmain Reviewedon httpswebrtcreviewgooglesourcecomcsrc Reviewedby Henrik Lundin henriklundinwebrtcorg CrCommitPosition refsbranchheads CrBranchedFrom adacdcedadcccfacarefsheadsmain

author: Mike Hommey
message: Bug Fix runclangtidy invocation rfirefoxbuildsystemreviewersahochheiden The runclangtidy script in clang changed such that it always normalizes paths from the database Before that change we were lucky that it didnt because the paths in the database are absolute and it skipped calling ospathabspath in that case On Windows ospathabspath implies slash normalization What that means is that the files we pass on the command line then dont match whats in the database anymore because we pass paths with forward slashes and the normalization of the database paths makes them use backslashes So we need to normalize the paths we pass to clangtidy But what runclangtidy really expects is regexps so backslashes also need to be escaped Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Chris DuPuis
message: Bug Stub installer exit code enhancements rErchennalexander Installer telemetry misses some cases where installation would be aborted specifically The OS is too old Windows The hardware is missing support for a required feature SSE There is insufficient space on the drive The target location is not writable Also the default error reported by telemetry indicates that the user cancelled the download regardless of the actual error This change addresses these issues This change also modifies the URL that the user is directed to when we determine that they are running on Windows or The old URL was the System Requirements page The new URL is httpssupportmozillaorgkbfirefoxuserswindowsandmovingextendedsupport Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Drew Willcoxon
message: Bug Prevent the Suggest Rust component from using a dummy remote settings URL in tests rdaisuke This error is harmless and originates in the remote settings Rust component which the suggest Rust component relies on The exact line that raises the error is The equivalent Searchfox link of the vendored code is The problem is that url is dataremotesettingsdummyv the dummy RS server URL thats set by the xpcshell and browser test harnesses Urljoin doesnt work on cannotbeabase URLs like data URIs Thats why this error is logged only in nonSuggest tests Suggest remains enabled for those tests but of course they dont use the mock RS server thats used for Suggest tests so while theyre running Suggest and remote settings are trying to use that dummy URL This patch allows the RS config to be set to null in SuggestBackendRust In that case the backend wont try to create the Suggest store at all effectively disabling Rust suggestions Rust suggestions were already effectively disabled in nonSuggest tests due to this URL error that plus the fact that theres no RS server to serve Rust suggestions during nonSuggest tests httpsgithubcommozillaapplicationservicesblobdabdbeddadeaebaacomponentsremote settingssrcconfigrsL httpssearchfoxorgmozillacentralrevfbfbeceafbcafffdbcdcbdthird partyrustremote settingssrcconfigrs httpsdocsrsurllatesturlstructUrlhtmlmethodjoin Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Beth Rennie
message: Bug Add a targeting context ping to Nimbus rchumphreysTravisLongahochheiden We now collect targeting attributes from the Nimbus targeting context into a set of metrics under the nimbus targeting context category Additionally we also collect information about the Nimbus targeting contexts environment ie things that are not attributes in the context but are available eg through the prefIsUserSet or preferenceValue filters in the nimbus targeting environment category Any errors encountered in evaluating the attributes or getting pref values are recorded in metrics in the targeting environment Finally we also optionally report the entire contents of the nimbus targeting context category as a stringified JSON blob in a metric which is disabled by default to enable debugging of targeting context errors in the field Tests have been added in test targeting context metricspy which will generate a dump of the targeting context metadata ie what fields and prefs are present and compare them to the contents of metricsyaml which will ensure the metric and targeting context stay in sync This patch does not limit the actual targeting context of Nimbus to these attributes That will be completed in a followup Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Nicolas Silva
message: Bug Ship dxcompilerdll and dxildll rsylvestreglandiumfirefoxbuildsystemreviewers This patch is the first step towards shipping dxcompilerdll and dxildll also referred to as DXC on Windows for WebGPU With this patch DXC is disabled by default at build time and can be enabled on x by adding ac add options enabledxcompiler in the mozconfig file Followup work will include in no particular order Enabling DXC by default Enabling DXC for Windows on x and arm architectures Using our own DXC builds instead of pulling the dlls from the Windows SDK Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Dave Townsend
message: Bug Keep a strong reference to the taskbar icon controller as long as the window is alive rjhirsch A windows icon controller is only held weakly by the widget code and once it is destroyed it appears to completely remove the taskbar entry for that window This maintains a strong reference the the icon controller once created until the window that owns it is destroyed Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

message: Bug Remove some mozuserinput usage from UA sheets rmasayuki For print preview make stuff inert For editor remove it The typehidden rules are clearly unnecessary typehidden has display none so they do nothing The others feel fairly arbitrary why file but not color for example Try to simplify it If someone complains we can probably add IsEditable checks in the relevant places in the DOM but I dont think we really care weve started enabling more and more events for these Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD

author: Jens Stutte
message: Bug Have a special array of eternal strong reporters added from nsMemoryReporterManagerInit rxpcomreviewersnika StrongReportersTable and WeakReportersTable are hash maps keyed on the reporters pointer thus its location in memory which results in a hardly foreseeable execution order when iterating over those tables Even more tweaking jemalloc as we do in bug can easily influence the position of newly allocated objects and thus change the execution order To make at least the basic reporters defined by nsMemoryReporterManager itself execute in a deterministic order we introduce an additional array that holds only the strong reporters added in Init Those reporters are kept alive until the manager lives and are supposed to be sync when dispatched Differential Revision httpsphabricatorservicesmozillacomD
